profiles:
Experience SWE Intern on the Medical Knowledge Team Google May 2015  – Present (3 months) Intern and Technical Consultant Towerview Healthcare February 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Taking one’s medicine on a daily schedule seems easy on paper, but I know from experience how easily it slips the mind. I reached out to learn more when I heard that a team of Duke Alumni was developing a device to track when people take their drugs and partner with their doctors to encourage compliance through smart reminders. I have since helped them build their software and soon I will be working with care providers to learn about their feedback as we pilot the service. I hope that my contribution will help patients everywhere to manage their health. Intern in the Mayo Clinic Ventures Department Mayo Clinic June 2014  –  August 2014  (3 months) Rochester, MN Mayo Clinic Ventures helps doctors develop their ideas and discoveries that will “truly transform healthcare.” Here, I work with innovative doctors to help develop their ideas by critically analyzing and verifying their merits while trying to help evolve them into powerful applications. Google Student Ambassador at Duke University Google August 2013  –  May 2014  (10 months) Durham, NC With my experience as an intern at Google and being a finalist in the 2011 Google Science Fair, it was an easy decision to apply to become a Google Student Ambassador on campus. I had learned about so many free services for research and collaboration while at Google, and I was happy to let people know that they were available and demonstrate their usefulness. I was also very excited to get to try out Google Glass and let others at Duke University try it for themselves. It came in handy when I was on crutches for three months to be able to communicate hands-free. I could see similar technology being very helpful to the disabled community. Undergraduate Lab Assistant in the Nicolelis Lab Duke University April 2012  –  October 2013  (1 year 7 months) Duke University I have been trained to work directly with Macaques in the Duke Vivarium. As a lab, we work on developing Brain Computer Interfaces for direct neural control of robotics as well as neural feedback. I help run tests and help program the tests. Software Engineering Intern on the Hangouts API Team Google January 2013  –  August 2013  (8 months) Kirkland, WA I began programming in high school and have found that it is both something I am quite good at and useful in many areas of my life. I admire Google’s focus on empowering the world with knowledge, and how active their employees are in their communities. After a tough interview process, I worked as an intern on the Google Hangouts team in Kirkland, WA, and learned a lot over the course of last summer. I took the idea of making it easier to help others in live video conversations and turned it into a full feature largely on my own which was released by the end of summer as "Control Room". I worked with Al Jazeera and the Huffington Post to test it, received a peer bonus, and had a glowing exit interview. Engineering Intern in the Core Technologies Division Medtronic June 2011  –  August 2011  (3 months) Minneapolis, MN At the Medtronic World Headquarters, I worked on a variety of projects. I designed, 3D modeled, and then used a material testing apparatus for hyper elastic metal wires. I designed and implemented a testing protocol for synchronized high speed image capture and tensile testing and wrote code to analyze large sets of image files. The image analysis code implemented both blob and edge detection to track marks. I also prepared and tested the material properties of animal heart valve tissue before and after thawing. Experience Online Marketing and Branding Intern - Google Search App Team Google June 2015  – Present (2 months) London, United Kingdom Identify and implement best practices in B2C digital marketing with the objective to increase the usage of the Google app among our core audience and especially across influencers within this audience.  
1. To gather latest innovation and best practices in mobile digital marketing (direct response and branding) 
2. Assess gaps in ongoing Google app downloads and usage campaigns and implement changes to achieve best in class performance 
3. Gather and identify best practices in social marketing: focus on targeting and tracking. Assess gaps in ongoing Google apps social campaigns and implement changes to achieve best in class performance 
 
Project Objectives: 
To maximise impact of digital and social marketing efforts to grow the usage of the Google app in order to enable users to get the best Google experience and drive growth of Google’s mobile revenue. Showcase Google using the latest digital innovation in our own campaigns as an example to support our team's efforts in growing digital marketing focus and sophistication of Google clients. Software Engineering Intern Google June 2014  –  September 2014  (4 months) Mountain View Worked on Cerebra team in Machine Intelligence to solve the problem of detecting planar surfaces in images from overlapping views. Data Science Intern Jawbone June 2013  –  August 2013  (3 months) I worked on the data science team at Jawbone to perform analysis on the data gathered from their Up personal fitness band. Resident Computer Consultant Stanford University January 2013  –  June 2013  (6 months) In charge of assisting residents with computer problems ranging from network connections to printing issues to OS issues. Also held this position September 2014 - June 2015. Data Science Intern Ayasdi June 2012  –  June 2013  (1 year 1 month) Utilizing Ayasdi software in conjunction with my programming skills in order to manipulate, cleanup, and analyze large data sets. Their software primarily uses topology to illustrate previously unseen relationships, similarities and connections between data points in large data sets. I did analysis on data sets ranging from pharmaceutical studies to police data to sports. With one other data scientist reached out to and worked with two NBA teams including the world champion Miami Heat in scouting and player evaluation. Research Intern Stanford Graduate School of Business July 2011  –  August 2011  (2 months) Worked with Professor George Foster, the premier professor in sports business at the Stanford GSB, planning, compiling, and analyzing large data sets as part of his research in sports business, most notably on cable television ratings in the NBA. Summary Hi, I am a first-year PhD student studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at UC Berkeley, where I hope to do research on brain-machine interfaces for the visual and motor cortex.  
 
My interests are pretty broad and span basic research, technology and new ventures. The tech industry is hard to pin down and I'm still trying to figure out where I fit into it. Although I'm focusing in on neuroengineering in the immediate future my background is all over the place and includes semiconductors, control systems, and RF and digital hardware. If you're interested in some of these things, we should chat! Please don't hesitate to get in touch with me. Experience Graduate Researcher UC Berkeley June 2015  – Present (2 months) I haven't started my program yet, but my research will likely be at the intersection of Electrical Engineering and Neuroscience, with an emphasis on tools and models for understanding activity in the motor and visual cortex. Software Engineering Intern Google June 2015  – Present (2 months) San Francisco Bay Area I write software for one of the advanced sensor teams that supports the self-driving car effort at Google [X] President, IEEE student chapter Rice University May 2014  –  May 2015  (1 year 1 month) I was co-president of the Rice undergraduate chapter of IEEE for the 2014-2015 school year. We fund-raised, threw multiple events every month, reviewed curriculum, hosted speakers, and generally oversaw the day-to-day activities of the chapter. Our goal was (and is, going forward) to promote fellowship among electrical engineers at Rice and to connect them with fulfilling academic and professional opportunities. Undergraduate Researcher Rice University January 2013  –  May 2015  (2 years 5 months) Houston, Texas Area Spring 2013: Constructed and implemented a USB solenoid valve controller to be used for on-chip microfluidic valves. 
 
Fall 2013: Designed, built, and optimized a syringe-manipulation device used to control hydrostatic syringe pressure for precise microfluidic experiments. Summary I am a PhD student in Stanford's Institute for Computational and Mathematical Engineering (http://icme.stanford.edu/). 
 
I mostly work on network and matrix computations. My interests and specialties include data mining, graph algorithms, network science, large-scale matrix and network computations, and parallel computing. Own It is bridging the gap between female leaders of the 21st century and the millennials who admire them, by shaking up the women's leadership arena and producing accessible events for college-age women. Levo, the Latin root of the word “elevate,” encompasses Levo League’s mission: to elevate your career. Join Levo to discover the best job opportunities, master new skills, and connect with our growing global network to start accelerating your success now.  
 
Launched in 2012 by Caroline Ghosn and Amanda Pouchot, Levo League encourages women to build a social network devoted to career development. Levo League has garnered support from renowned investors including Sheryl Sandberg, COO of Facebook; Susan Lyne, CEO of AOL’s Brand Group; and Gina Bianchini, Founder of Mightybell and former CEO of Ning. Summary Programmer, leader, mentor, student.  
 
I interned at Microsoft in high school on the Translate Team, and started a Computer Science club at my high school which now keeps growing.  
 
Since then, I've interned at Google on the YouTube Desktop team, this summer I am back at Google on the Search Engine team, and in the fall I will be joining Facebook as an intern.  
 
I am a rising junior at the University of Washington, studying Computer Science. This past year I served the CSE community at my school as a Google Student Ambassador and ACM leader.  
 
In the meantime I enjoy interviewing, competing in hackathons, attending tech conferences, traveling, working on my own personal projects, speaking at tech events such as the Washington STEM Summit, serving as a leader on campus, mentoring other students who wish to pursue computer science, and just being a college student. 
 
I enjoy tackling tough technical challenges, learning new skills, and meeting inspirational people both in and out of the tech industry that motivate me to work hard and enjoy the ride :)

Summary I am currently attending the University of Illinois with an RA. I work with Prof. Derek Hoiem and Prof. David Forsyth. My research lies somewhere between vision and graphics with a focus on geometric reconstruction. 
 
I graduated from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in 2012. While at RPI I was heavily involved in research with Prof. Chuck Stewart in collaboration with the HabCam group, a cooperation between NOAA fisheries and WHOI. My part of this was illumination correction for underwater imagery as well as basic substrate classification using texture recognition. Summary I am interested in experimenting with as much of Computer Science as I can, in order to find the field that is best suited for me, in which I can make a difference. 
Also, I want to connect with as many people as I can. 
 
The topics that really interest me are Machine Learning and Web Technologies. 
 
During my bachelors studies at the Computer Science I have had the pleasure of working on some great projects as a student collaborator at Google Summer of Code (Speech Recognition software), as an intern at Google (YouTube and Developers Console) and as an intern at ARIA (Romanian Association for Artificial Intelligence). It has also been a pleasure to be a member of ROSEdu and help organize and take part in their activities. 
 
I am trying to learn as much as possible and have fun at the same time by participating in hackatons or reading online articles. 
 
The technologies and languages used in my studies and extracurricular activities are Java (+ Android), Javascript, Python and Linux Shell.
